channel.title: Tom Lisi - LancasterOnline RSS
channel.description: Latest articles by Tom Lisi from LancasterOnline

item.title: East Cocalico Twp. district judge's office to get new location
item.description: After a 30-year run, a magisterial district judge office in East Cocalico Township is set to relocate to a new and bigger space at 935 Stone Hill Road.

item.title: Investigation of voter registration fraud in Lancaster County moved to Pa. AG's office
item.description: Editor's note: This story was updated at 5:12 p.m. on Tuesday, Jan. 21, to reflect statements from District Attorney Heather Adams and Lancaster County commissioners.

item.title: State, local officials scramble to gauge impact of Trump’s federal aid freeze
item.description: State and local elected officials were left scrambling Tuesday to measure the impact of the broad executive order issued by President Donald Trump Monday evening to freeze the distribution of all federal grant money.

item.title: Lancaster County makes moves ahead of special election in 36th Senate District
item.description: Editor's note: This story was updated on Wednesday, Jan. 29 at 1:19 p.m. to reflect that the Libertarian Party has nominated Mount Joy resident Zachary Moore for the 36th Senate District race.

item.title: Activist urges Lancaster County commissioners to fight Three Mile Island reopening
item.description: A longtime government-reform activist known for his attention-getting props and feisty public awareness campaigns urged Lancaster County commissioners on

item.title: Three Mile Island owner defends safety record and planning of restart
item.description: The company that owns the Three Mile Island nuclear plant defended the planning and safety record of the facility Thursday, after a local activist urged Lancaster County commissioners Wednesday to fight a plan to restart one of the plant’s reactors.

item.title: Lancaster County's new president judge may need to pick a new commissioner
item.description: In his first weeks as Lancaster County Courts’ president judge, Leonard G. Brown III has had to give some thought to a seldom-exercised but consequential duty: appointing a county commissioner.

item.title: New Lancaster prison project calls for $10M more in county funds to consultants
item.description: Lancaster County commissioners are set to vote Wednesday on whether to set aside $10 million in county funds to pay for continued planning of the new prison project, now stretching into its third year.

item.title: Judge appoints cybersecurity lawyer to Lancaster County elections board
item.description: Lancaster County President Judge Leonard G. Brown III appointed attorney Donald Geiter to the Lancaster County Board of Elections on Wednesday, filling a seat Commissioner Josh Parsons vacated in order to run in a special election for state Senate.

item.title: Lancaster County commissioners approve $18M for 2025 capital projects
item.description: Lancaster County commissioners approved a plan Wednesday to use $18 million from a capital improvement fund to pay for various projects and purchases, more than half of which is slated to go to planning a new prison.

item.title: Officials weigh changes at Lancaster County Youth Intervention Center
item.description: The Lancaster County Youth Intervention Center’s board of managers Friday dismissed county Commissioner Alice Yoder's request that they consider a deeper review of the facility’s policies and procedures.

item.title: Lancaster County Prison program gets spotlight at Leadership Lancaster
item.description: Editor's note: This story has been updated to reflect Mary Glazier's title as a professor emerita of sociology.
